channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Ugandan LGBT Activist Recommended For Asylum In U.S.
item.description: John Abdallah Wambere applied for asylum in the U.S. after Uganda passed a harsh anti-gay law earlier this year. His application has now been recommended for approval, pending a background check.
item.content:encoded:
John Abdallah Wambere applied for asylum in the U.S. after Uganda passed a harsh anti-gay law earlier this year. His application has now been recommended for approval, pending a background check.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: Thousands Of Refugees Flee Syria In Chaotic Scene At Turkey's Border
item.description: While a U.N. agency reported about 70,000 refugees this weekend, a Turkish official says 100,000 Syrians have entered Turkey in the past week. Fighters from ISIS are closing in on the border.
item.content:encoded:
While a U.N. agency reported about 70,000 refugees this weekend, a Turkish official says 100,000 Syrians have entered Turkey in the past week. Fighters from ISIS are closing in on the border.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Snowden Reveal Makes Israeli Spies' Protest An American Issue
item.description: Forty-three veterans of Unit 8200, Israel's secretive surveillance organization, say they were directed to spy indiscriminately on Palestinians. Were they using intelligence gathered by the NSA?
item.content:encoded:
Forty-three veterans of Unit 8200, Israel's secretive surveillance organization, say they were directed to spy indiscriminately on Palestinians. Were they using intelligence gathered by the NSA?

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: For Oktoberfest-Goers In Munich, A Parade And A Party
item.description: Munich kicked off this year's Oktoberfest Saturday, beginning festivities in which the city expects to host 6 million visitors. For the first time, beer prices are above 10 euros per liter.
item.content:encoded:
Munich kicked off this year's Oktoberfest Saturday, beginning festivities in which the city expects to host 6 million visitors. For the first time, beer prices are above 10 euros per liter.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: One Year After Kenyan Mall Attack, Few Answers Have Emerged
item.description: The people behind a vicious attack were identified as Islamist militants from Somalia, but few other details about the incident have been made public.
item.content:encoded:
The people behind a vicious attack were identified as Islamist militants from Somalia, but few other details about the incident have been made public.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: A Forgotten Referendum On The Union Of Scots And English
item.description: In 2011, there was a vote on closing the version of Wikipedia written in the Scottish language variety, Scots. The episode reminds us how language intersects with politics and class.
item.content:encoded:
In 2011, there was a vote on closing the version of Wikipedia written in the Scottish language variety, Scots. The episode reminds us how language intersects with politics and class.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Matt Thompson

item.title: Afghan Presidential Rivals End Dispute â€” And A Long Election Season
item.description: The top two presidential candidates in Afghanistan shake hands and sign a power-sharing deal, ending months of bitter disputes over who will succeed Hamid Karzai.
item.content:encoded:
The top two presidential candidates in Afghanistan shake hands and sign a power-sharing deal, ending months of bitter disputes over who will succeed Hamid Karzai.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Sean Carberry

item.title: Afghan Presidential Candidates Sign Power-Sharing Agreement
item.description: When the Afghan presidential elections were held, each candidates proclaimed himself the winner. Correspondent Sean Carberry tells NPR's Wade Goodwyn a power-sharing deal has been hammered out.
item.content:encoded:
When the Afghan presidential elections were held, each candidates proclaimed himself the winner. Correspondent Sean Carberry tells NPR's Wade Goodwyn a power-sharing deal has been hammered out.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Syrian Refugees Flood Turkish Border
item.description: Tens of thousands of Syrian refugees are fleeing fighting between Kurdish forces and the Islamic State militants. NPR's Wade Goodwyn speaks to correspondent Deb Amos from the border about the crisis.
item.content:encoded:
Tens of thousands of Syrian refugees are fleeing fighting between Kurdish forces and the Islamic State militants. NPR's Wade Goodwyn speaks to correspondent Deb Amos from the border about the crisis.

» E-Mail This

item.title: U.S. Launches Media Campaign To Counter ISIS Videos
item.description: The Islamic State is posting graphic violent images on social media to recruit fighters. NPR's Wade Goodwyn speaks with the State Department's Alberto Fernandez about the U.S.'s aggressive response.
item.content:encoded:
The Islamic State is posting graphic violent images on social media to recruit fighters. NPR's Wade Goodwyn speaks with the State Department's Alberto Fernandez about the U.S.'s aggressive response.

» E-Mail This

item.title: U.S., Iraqi Militias Join In Uneasy Alliance
item.description: Shiite militias that once fought bitterly against U.S. forces in Iraq are now the beneficiaries of American airstrikes against the Islamic State. But there's distrust all around.
item.content:encoded:
Shiite militias that once fought bitterly against U.S. forces in Iraq are now the beneficiaries of American airstrikes against the Islamic State. But there's distrust all around.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Alice Fordham

item.title: Afghan Rivals Have Signed Power-Sharing Agreement
item.description: The country's presidential election, which has been disputed for months, is finally be coming to an end, as the two candidates signed a deal Sunday to create a unity government.
item.content:encoded:
The country's presidential election, which has been disputed for months, is finally be coming to an end, as the two candidates signed a deal Sunday to create a unity government.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Dozens Of ISIS Hostages Freed And Sent To Turkey
item.description: The militant group calling itself the Islamic State released 49 hostages, most of them Turkish. NPR's Arun Rath talks to NPR Middle East Correspondent Deborah Amos about what the release signals.
item.content:encoded:
The militant group calling itself the Islamic State released 49 hostages, most of them Turkish. NPR's Arun Rath talks to NPR Middle East Correspondent Deborah Amos about what the release signals.

» E-Mail This

item.title: When The U.S. Backs Rebels, It Doesn't Often Go As Planned
item.description: As the U.S. begins to arm and train Syrian rebels, here's a look at the very mixed record of U.S. support for rebel movements from Angola to Afghanistan.
item.content:encoded:
As the U.S. begins to arm and train Syrian rebels, here's a look at the very mixed record of U.S. support for rebel movements from Angola to Afghanistan.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Over Spain's Objections, Catalonia Plans Referendum On Independence
item.description: Now that Scotland has voted to stay in the U.K., attention is turning to another separatist movement. Emboldened by the peaceful Scottish referendum, Catalans are planning a vote in November.
item.content:encoded:
Now that Scotland has voted to stay in the U.K., attention is turning to another separatist movement. Emboldened by the peaceful Scottish referendum, Catalans are planning a vote in November.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer
